intro: Trema humbertii, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Urticaceae family, which includes other species known for their stinging hairs. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture with prominent veins. Trema humbertii produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by distinctive, three-lobed fruits.
